abstract: Labor Dept reports Producer Price Index declined 0.3 percent in December, largest drop in more than three years; declining prices amount to cautionary signal for the Federal Reserve as it mulls over potential shifts in monetary policy; also reports claims for weekly unemployment benefits rose by 19,000 to seasonally adjusted 316,000.
lead_paragraph: Prices at the factory gate declined by 0.3 percent in December, the Labor Department said, complicating the economic picture facing the Fed.
snippet: Prices at the factory gate declined by 0.3 percent in December, the Labor Department said, complicating the economic picture facing the Fed.

headline.main: U.S. Producer Prices Drop, Putting Pressure on the Fed
headline.print_headline: U.S. Producer Prices Drop, Putting Pressure on the Fed
